statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: The Boston Celtics took a share of first-place in the Atlantic Division earlier this season. Now Paul Pierce has shot them into a tie for the Eastern Conference lead.
article.headline: Pierce nets 36, says Celts have high goals

images.name: Pierce, Paul 011221 inline
images.caption: Paul Pierce scored 36 points with a variety of spectacular shots.

article.linkText: Celtics sting Jazz, tie Nets for top spot in East
article.story:
BOSTON (AP) -- The Boston Celtics took a share of first-place in the Atlantic Division earlier this season. Now Paul Pierce has shot them into a tie for the Eastern Conference lead. Pierce scored 36 points, and Kenny Anderson added a season-high 18 to lead Boston to its fifth straight home victory, 98-92 over the Utah Jazz on Friday night. "It's a good feeling, but we want more," Pierce said. "We want to take it another step up. It's a long season and we've only played one third of it." The Celtics have won 11 of 13 games to improve to 16-8 overall and move into a tie with New Jersey for first place in the division and the conference. The last time the Celtics were eight games over .500 was in 1991-92. "It's still early," Celtics coach Jim O'Brien said. "I will be ecstatic if we're in first and it's the last game of the season. We've got a long way to go, but I'm pleased that we're 16-8." Utah took a 74-73 lead on Andrei Kirilenko's basket with 9:40 left in the game, but the Celtics responded with a 8-0 run, capped by Pierce's 3-pointer and a free throw by Anderson. "I was just hitting my shots tonight. That's all," Anderson said. "They were getting me the ball. ... I can score. I came into this league as a scorer, but that's not my concern right now. I'm just trying to lead the team." After a pair of free throws by Jarron Collins, Antoine Walker found Pierce for an alley-oop to make it 83-76. Pierce's baseline drive four minutes later gave Boston a 10-point lead. The Jazz came back and cut the deficit to 94-90 on Bryon Russell's 3-pointer with 1:15 remaining, but Pierce swatted Donyell Marshall's shot and then sank a pair of free throws with 39 seconds left to drop Utah to 12-15. "It's frustrating," said Jazz forward Karl Malone, who led Utah with 22 points. "We're used to winning seven or eight games at a time. I'm not used to being three games under .500. It's not like you're happy about it, but it's just one of those things." Pierce scored 17 points in the fourth quarter, while Walker finished with 19 points, eight rebounds and seven assists. Six other Utah players finished in double figures, including Marshall with 16 and John Stockton with 12. Utah took a 32-25 lead on Marshall's dunk midway through the second quarter, but the Celtics went on a 22-13 run over the rest of the half to go into halftime with a two-point advantage. The victory was Boston's second straight at home against Utah after failing to beat the Jazz in its previous seven attempts.

Game notes
Malone played in his 1,300th NBA game. ... The Jazz activated Russell (fractured pelvis) from the injured list and put Quincy Lewis on the IL with left Achilles' tendinitis. Russell has played in 10 games and is averaging 7.3 points while Lewis is averaging four points in 25 games. ... The Celtics are 9-0 when Walker has seven or more assists. ... Celtics reserve point guard Milt Palacio didn't play for the first time this season. ... Boston is 7-0 when Pierce attempts 10 or more free throws. He was 12-of-14 against Utah.
